title: Was almost a great product
content: I bought this in the prime day sale on 15th July, only by the brand value, as inalsa products are great value for money as we also have other products of them. On my first try for this product i tried using mccain potato cubes in this. I started the fryer, and wall was going great for 4-5 mins until suddenly the heating light went off, i thought it was a cycle thing, but 10-15 sec later , the power light went off while the timer was still running as it is spring based. I tried to take the container out and re-insert it. the power and heating lights went online, and that is when i realised as i left the handle that these were pressure based and as soon as i left the pressure on the handle , there might have been a connection problem due to loose grip, the lights went off again. I gave it 2-3 more tries , normally holding it thinking it was a one off thing. But the same happened over and over again. Then i immediately ordered a return which was quick.. Although there was a problem in the piece, i lost the interest in the product itself, the potato bites did actually get cooked properly, but i lost the trust in the mechanism. I ll try some other brand some other time now.

title: Affordable Air fryer with large capacity.
content: We have used this Air fryer on an average 3 times per week in the past one month. So far we have made chips, roasted veggies, cutlets, pizza, and cake. For some items you might need to oil the base a little more.. Ideally you can place an piece of foil to collect the excess oil which can prevent the oil from spoiling the base. Try to clean the fryer once it's cooled down but still a little hot. This will make it easier to get the oil out.. The size is about half the width of a common microwave..
